what: Upload the zip file to a Google Drive folder
title: Back up GitHub repositories
text: Thanks @k-doering-NOAA providing solution. approach uses auto auth setting interaction needed. See gargle’s “Non-interactive auth” vignette details: full R script example can found : inst/extdata/examples/example_back_up_gh.R.
code: options(gargle_oauth_email = "*@noaa.gov")  zip_name <- "ghBackup.zip" zip_path <- file.path(dirname(backup_path), zip_name) googledrive::drive_put(   media = zip_path,   path = googledrive::as_id("https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1vju2qQ0dPh49Ay7VGaWv6CvGqMZsZKPc"),   name = zip_name )

title: Back up GitHub repositories
text: can schedule R script/workflow Windows using Windows task scheduler. add task R script, need install taskscheduleR package run example code : full R script example can found : inst/extdata/examples/example_task_schedule.R. might interested cronR package like automate R workflow Linux/Unix.
code: install.packages("taskscheduleR") library(taskscheduleR)  # R script with tasks task_script <- system.file(   "extdata", "example_back_up_gh.R",   package = "ghBackup" )  # Run every 5 mins, starting from within 60 seconds taskscheduleR::taskscheduler_create(   taskname = "ghBackup_5min",   rscript = task_script ,   schedule = "MINUTE",   startdate = format(Sys.Date(), "%m/%d/%Y"),   starttime = format(Sys.time() + 60, "%H:%M"),   modifier = 5 )
